comment.body: oops, yeah, i got confused with the many apps. 31 is the minum we need for google play, but we can do 33 straight away if it works. another round of testing then :D

issue.title: update the WWDRCA certificate recommendation
issue.body:
Currently the plugin recommends downloading `https://apple.com/certificationauthority/AppleWWDRCA.cer`, which is set to expire on Feb. 7, 2023, 9:48 p.m. (only 4ish months from now). 

This updates the recommendation to download `https://apple.com/certificationauthority/AppleWWDRCAG4.cer`, which replaced this certificate (per https://developer.apple.com/news/?id=5zb13auf). 

This PR does **_not_** include code to check whether the Apple WWDRCA has expired, nor that it is set to expire soon. It simply updates the translations.

comment.body: Thanks, we'll absolutely merge this, I just want to check if there's even more we can or should do with regards to this expiration on our end

pull_request.title: Merge consecutive identical lines on receipt
pull_request.body:
Customers rightfully complain that buying 30 tickets uses up a lot of receipt paper when it does not need to.

In pretixPOS, we have good reasons for not merging receipt lines since they can individually be interacted with, therefore I propose to merge really only upon printing. I was struggling whether to put this logic into POS or PRINT, but I think it's okay to put it here.

issue.title: Django signal instrumentation breaks receiver signatures

milestone.title: Django update
milestone.description: Collections of improvements to our Django integration.

issue.body:
### How do you use Sentry?

Sentry Saas (sentry.io)

### Version

1.9.9

### Steps to Reproduce

I have my own instrumentation around django signals which was broken by the changes in pull request #1526. (commit 412f824b8b53c444671c81ec8e119eba66308064)

My code wraps the django signal class, and makes use of the `receiver.__name__`. As of sentry version 1.9.9, I receive the wrapper name, rather than the expected receiver method name. 

My code (simplified):
```
class TimedSignal(Signal):
    """ Same as signal, but we report on any slow functions """
    def send(self, sender, **named):
        for receiver in self._live_receivers(sender):
            print("receiver.__qualname__ =", receiver.__qualname__)
            print("receiver.__name__ =", receiver.__name__)
            ... (logic with these values) ...
```

Suggested fix:
The `wrapper` method defined within `sentry_receiver_wrapper` should use builtin [functools.wraps](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functools.html#functools.wraps), to maintain the signature of the original method. 

For example:
```
from functools import wraps
...
        def sentry_receiver_wrapper(receiver):
            # type: (Callable[..., Any]) -> Callable[..., Any]
            @wraps(receiver)
            def wrapper(*args, **kwargs):
```


### Expected Result

I expect to see information about the original receiver method, for example:
```
receiver.__qualname__ = fetch_driver_change_data
receiver.__name__ = fetch_driver_change_data
```


### Actual Result

Instead, I get information about the sentry wrapper:
```
receiver.__qualname__ = patch_signals.<locals>._sentry_live_receivers.<locals>.sentry_receiver_wrapper.<locals>.wrapper
receiver.__name__ = wrapper
```

comment.body: This also just broke our system and I'Ve verified that the suggested fix above works
